comments.body: Will the policy change if I specify OrphanDependents=false in DeleteOptions now?
Yes. DeleteOptions have the highest priority. The existing finalizers on the object has the second highest priority. This default policy has the lowest priority.
This is a backwards-incompatible API change.  I don't think that we can do this in v1 unless we believe there is a security risk to the cluster to not change it.

I had raised that concern prior to submitting the PR.

See @bgrant0607 comment here:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/4909#issuecomment-143383218

I agree with his analysis.

Ok, I agree as well.
